intro: Casearia thwaitesii, commonly known as the white casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in catkins, typical of the genus Casearia. Its fruits are elongated, woody capsules that split open to release tiny seeds. Casearia thwaitesii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
